Troubleshooting¶

Troubleshooting¶

Error

Possible cause - Remedy

The OfficeLink menu/toolbar no longer appears after the start. However, according to the settings menu of the corresponding Office application, the Add-In is enabled.

Make sure that the Add-In has not been made ‘invisible’ via the pop-up menu of the Office application or via its settings menu.

The OfficeLink menu/toolbar no longer appears after the start. According to the settings menu of the corresponding Office application, the Add-In is disabled or not listed at all.

Certain Add-Ins from the Office application can be disabled in the case of unexpected malfunctions of the Office application or the OfficeLink-Toolbar nicht in Excel 2003 und Word 2003, in anderen Office-Anwendungen wie PowerPoint jedoch schon.

Microsoft Office: File –> Options –> Add-Ins –> “COM-Add-Ins” oder “Disabled Items” (in Combo Box)

Under certain circumstances, the Add-In can only be reactivated manually in the corresponding registry path:

<HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE and/or HKEY_CURRENT_USER>/SOFTWARE/Microsoft/Office/ [???]/Addins/OfficeLink.Connect

[???] = Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Project or Word. The higher-level “Office/” directory is omitted for the Visio path.

In this directory, the value of the LoadBehavior key must be reset from 2 to 3.

In case of multiple occurrences, ensure that other recently installed Add-Ins cannot be the cause of this behavior.

When generating a PowerReport, Excel is terminated, freezes or crashes.

Re-create report template, if necessary. Here, set up the report step by step and check whether the report can still be filled correctly. Problems continue to appear on the Excel side, particularly when filling lists with certain formatting. In this regard, sacrifices might have to be made since, for technical reasons, Excel cannot import data and format it correspondingly at the same time.

When a PowerReport is generated, the report remains empty or no more document variables are automatically updated when an Excel file is opened.

Check whether Excel is explicitly configured in the Windows client as viewer for Excel files. As a result, Excel may no longer send events to add-ins, making OfficeLink seem inactive.

Various malfunctions are caused when generating a PowerReport with embedded macros for post processing.

Make sure that the macro is not blocked temporarily or even completely by messages (see Office security center > Settings for macros). If higher security settings for macros are desired, the report templates should be signed. Otherwise, “Enable all macros” should be selected.

When generating a PowerReport, Excel reports that the size of an XML table can’t be alter to receive all data, or that no data or not all data has been imported.

Due to Excel restrictions the max. amount of XML tag rows in the XML files, which are loaded during an XML data import, must not exceed 65535.

No XML schema can be loaded ([Select data source] or [Update XML schema]). Error message in the OfficeLink log: “The file already exists”

Make sure that the temporary Windows directory (%TEMP%) is not overfilled and clear it if necessary.

A faulty response or no response is caused when initiating a system operation.

Manually check whether working with the system is possible. If necessary, restart OfficeLink and system client.

The preset mask fields when creating documents in the system do not correspond to the desired values.

False configuration of the presetting fields in the system.

A document is opened in the system for editing, but all OfficeLink toolbar buttons remain grayed out in Office.

Make sure that the directory where the currently opened document is located is not within a directory structure managed by CONTACT Workspace Manager. This means that a directory with the name ".wsm" must not be located in the same directory or in a higher-level directory.

When synchronizing metadata, the variable fields in ‘older’ system documents are not filled (documents created with a system version older than 2.9.8). In some circumstances, both synchronization buttons are grayed out erroneously.

Open a document for editing. Use the [ Manage ] button of the OfficeLink toolbar to open and close the wizard for defining variables. The variables are corrected internally by this procedure. Save the modified document in the system.

During metadata synchronization, fields remain empty even though their associated attributes are assigned in the system.

Use the [ Settings ] button of the OfficeLink toolbar to open the settings dialog for the respective Office application and set the check box Show error in the document under Metadata. This always fills fields in the document with potential error messages.

After the metadata synchronisation, a text or number value unintendedly appears as date in Excel.

Right click the corresponding cell and then choose Format Cells. In the Format Cells dialog choose Text.

Message about missing rights while trying to manage document variables or transfer metdata to the system.

Be sure, that the CAD switch Allow Metadata Manage, respectively Allow Metadata Write, is activated for the related user.

Message about document protection when updating metadata in Word.

This security message can be bypassed, if required, by activating the CAD switch Allow Force Metadata Write for the related user.

Various malfunctions both on the link side as well as the Office side.

Update Windows/Office, i.e. run Windows Updates. Occasionally this randomly fixes things that cannot be explained otherwise. Documents saving incorrectly when using the PowerPivot Add-Ins from Microsoft at the same time is one example we could mention.
